introduction: This video provides advice on effectively preparing for technical interviews for senior principal or staff engineering roles at large companies, specifically focusing on system design and leadership. The author, a principal engineer at Amazon, shares their experience and recommends a balanced approach to interview preparation, emphasizing design and behavioral questions over coding problems.

sections.title: Section 1: Why Most Interview Prep Resources are Garbage
content: The emphasis on coding data structures and algorithms is overrated and leads to bad coding.
Bad hires can lower software quality and team morale, even in small companies.
Good hires not only write great code but also contribute meaningfully to projects.
Coding is necessary but not sufficient for senior engineering roles.

sections.title: Section 2: Understanding Situational and Behavioral Questions
content: Situational questions are about what to do in a specific situation, while behavioral questions are veiled.
Experience is crucial for answering system design questions.
Leadership questions are essential for senior engineering roles.
Creating a stable of stories demonstrates experience and leadership.

sections.title: Section 3: The Importance of Design and Leadership Questions
content: Design and leadership questions are more than half of what you should prepare for.
The percentage of coding, design, and leadership questions varies depending on the role.
Stories about leading teams through difficult situations are valuable.
Character development and communication are key for interview success.

sections.title: Section 4: Balancing Coding, Design, and Leadership Preparation
content: The recommended percentage for coding, design, and leadership questions is 30, 30, and 40%.
Principal engineers should allocate 20% for coding, 40% for design, and 40% for leadership.
Overemphasizing coding can lead to missed opportunities for growth.
Effective storytelling can make interview preparation more manageable.

sections.title: Section 5: The Secret to Exceptional Interview Performance
content: Creating a stable of stories that demonstrate experience and leadership is crucial.
Stories about teamwork and problem-solving can be particularly effective.
Effective storytelling can help the interviewer manage their cognitive load.
